metadata.synopsis: This hyena is full grown but acts more like a pup. He was raised by the goblins and tries his best to make them love him, but he is tormented by them constantly. He desperately wishes to flee but lacks the courage. Player can encourage him to stay or convince him to leave.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Speak with the Hyena at SCL_Main_A (92; 51; -52)

14.speaker: Hyena
14.text: Please don't talk to me. Or the goblins will be mad.
14.context: NodeContext: full of shame, scared the goblins will see

16.speaker: Hyena
16.context: NodeContext: sad and angry with the player

25.speaker: Hyena
25.context: NodeContext: player upset the hyena. He doesn't want to see the player.

27.speaker: Hyena
27.context: NodeContext: low, sad bark, not sure if player is friend or foe

23.speaker: Narrator
23.text: *The hyena watches you, and the surrounding camp, with eyes burdened by fear. He appears terrified.*

36.speaker: Narrator
36.text: *Judging by his bowed head, fearful nature, and underweight physique, this hyena is being abused by his goblin owners.*

57.speaker: Player
57.text: Hold out your hand, letting it sniff.

61.speaker: Narrator
61.context: CinematicNodeContext: The hyena's posture is happier

40.speaker: Player
40.text: Do you want to be here, boy? If not, you should get out of here. Go on! Go!

59.speaker: Narrator
59.text: *For a moment, it appears the hyena's fear is too great, but then...*

5.speaker: Narrator
5.text: *His voice is filled with determination as he prepares to flee - thankful to have found you, a friend.*

12.speaker: Narrator
12.text: *The creature cowers, too afraid to move.*

37.speaker: Player
37.text: You deserve to be out in the wild, not abused by goblins. Go on - go!

31.speaker: Player
31.text: You deserve to be out in the wild, not tormented by a goblin with a bone. Go on - go!

49.speaker: Player
49.text: You deserve to be out in the wild, not tormented by a goblin with a bone. Go on - go!

4.speaker: Player
4.text: Get out of here, or I'll beat you senseless - stupid mutt.

3.speaker: Narrator
3.text: *He flees, more terrified of you than the goblins.*

66.speaker: Player
66.text: You'll be a good boy for the Absolute, won't you?

9.speaker: Hyena
9.context: NodeContext: half hearted bark - clearly sad but attempts a tail wag

30.speaker: Hyena
30.context: CinematicNodeContext: sad whine but tries to raise his head to greet the playerNodeContext: sad whine but tries to raise his head to greet the player

69.speaker: Hyena
69.context: NodeContext: unsure if player will hurt them or not

34.speaker: Hyena
34.context: NodeContext: small sad voice, afraid he'll be beaten

1.speaker: Player
1.text: Depends. Why are you here all alone?

10.speaker: Hyena
10.text: The goblins left me behind. I'm a bad hyena.

21.speaker: Hyena
21.text: They beat me because I am weak. Because I am soft. Even though I try my best.
21.context: NodeContext: full of shame and sadness. He feels like he deserves it.

11.speaker: Player
11.text: You belong to the wild, little one. Go and be free.

17.speaker: Hyena
17.text: But - but the goblins said I must stay here. Or they'll cut me. Kill me.
17.context: NodeContext: player is trying to convince hyena to leave. He want to but he's terrified of the goblins

0.speaker: Player
0.text: You are a hunter, like me - swift and true. They'll never catch you.

60.speaker: Hyena
60.text: No, no it's too risky. I can't - I can't.

47.speaker: Player
47.text: If not now, when? Go on - while you still can.

73.speaker: Hyena
73.text: You're right. The goblins are cruel.

46.speaker: Player
46.text: I'll slit their necks if they so much as try.

6.speaker: Player
6.text: Let them try - I am nature's guardian. And I will not back down.

51.speaker: Hyena
51.text: You would fight the goblins? For me?
51.context: NodeContext: shock - no one has ever stood up for him before

52.speaker: Hyena
52.text: I - I'm scared. But I don't want them to hurt me anymore. Maybe I should go...
52.context: NodeContext: scared but growing more confident

15.speaker: Hyena
15.context: NodeContext: summon his courage - he's about to run away but not before he thanks his new friend

41.speaker: Hyena
41.context: CinematicNodeContext: head down, utterly dejectedNodeContext: heartwrencingly sad. Head down, dejected.

20.speaker: Hyena
20.text: No, no, they're trying to help me - you're the problem! Get away!

33.speaker: Player
33.text: You belong to the wild, not to the goblins. Go and be free.

72.speaker: Player
72.text: Fight back. Hurt the goblins like they hurt you.

29.speaker: Player
29.text: Without the goblins here, you can do whatever you want.

54.speaker: Hyena
54.text: I could never! I do what the goblins tell me - I want to be a good hyena.
54.context: NodeContext: surprised - really wants the goblins approval

2.speaker: Player
2.text: You deserve to be beaten. I've never met such a weakling.

58.speaker: Hyena
58.text: That makes me happy. I like the goblins, but the goblins... don't like me.
58.context: NodeContext: happy in the first half and then sadness and shame in the rest

70.speaker: Player
70.text: I'm more of a friend than the goblin with the bone. You know he tried to kill you?

43.speaker: Hyena
43.text: He... he did? Then I must have been bad.
43.context: NodeContext: player has told hyena one of the goblins tried to kill him. Full of shame.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: What's this sad act? You're a predator.

19.speaker: Hyena
19.text: The goblins say I can't be a predator.

55.speaker: Player
55.text: I could never be friends with such a pathetic creature.

68.speaker: Hyena
68.context: CinematicNodeContext: head down, utterly dejectedNodeContext: heartwrencingly sad. Head down, dejected.

71.speaker: Hyena
71.text: You came back? Am I - are you a friend?

76.speaker: Hyena
76.context: CinematicNodeContext: low head, not sure if player is going to be mean to him or not
